column2: Column Name
column8: Validations on Columns

column2: supplyType
column8: Only Inward or Outward is allowed

column2: subSupplyType
column8: Selection based on Inward or Outward transaction.

column2: docType
column8: Only Document Type with the corresponding Sub-Type is allowed.Refer Table 2 in the Validation sheet.

column2: docNo
column8: Only alpha numeric keys and  - (hyphen),   / (slash) and .(dot) are allowed.

column2: docDate
column8: Document Date should be in DD/MM/YYYY format

column2: fromTrdName
column8: Only alpha numeric keys and  - (hyphen)  / (slash) and .(dot) are allowed.

column2: fromGstin
column8: Only valid GSTIN are allowed.

column2: fromAddr1
column8: Only alpha numeric keys and  @,  # , -,  /,, &, . are allowed.

column2: fromAddr2
column8: Only alpha numeric keys and  @,  # , -,  /,, &, . are allowed.

column2: fromPlace
column8: Only alpha numeric keys and  @,  # , -,  /,, &, . are allowed.

column2: fromPincode
column8: Only 6 digits number is allowed, From_Pin Code should belongs  to  From_State.

column2: fromStateCode
column8: Only valid states are allowed.

column2: actFromStateCode
column4: State from where it is being dispatched
column8: Only valid states are allowed.

column2: toTrdName
column8: Only alpha numeric keys and  - (hyphen)  / (slash) and .(dot) are allowed.

column2: toGstin
column8: Only valid GSTIN are allowed.

column2: toAddr1
column8: Only alpha numeric keys and  @,  # , -,  /,, &, . are allowed.

column2: toAddr2
column8: Only alpha numeric keys and  @,  # , -,  /,, &, . are allowed.

column2: toPlace
column8: Only alpha numeric keys and  @,  # , -,  /,, &, . are allowed.

column2: toPincode
column8: Only 6 digits number is allowed, To_Pin Code should belongs  to  To_State.

column2: toStateCode
column8: Only valid states are allowed.

column2: actToStateCode
column4: State to where it is being shipped
column8: Only valid states are allowed.

column2: productName
column8: Only alpha numeric keys and  @,  # , -,  /,, &, . are allowed.

column2: productDesc
column8: Only alpha numeric keys and  @,  # , -,  /,, &, . are allowed.

column2: hsnCode
column8: Valid 4 digits or 8 digits HSN code is allowed.

column2: qtyUnit
column8: Valid Unit is allowed.

column2: quantity
column8: Only numbers are allowed.

column2: totalValue
column8: Only numbers are allowed.

column2: sgstRate,cgstRate,igstRate
column8: Only Standard Tax Rates are allowed(Refer Table 1 in the Validation sheet).

column2: cgstValue
column7: It's mandoatory when you generate e-waybill for same state
column8: Only numbers are allowed.

column2: sgstValue
column7: It's mandoatory when you generate e-waybill for same state
column8: Only numbers are allowed.

column2: igstValue
column7: It's mandoatory when you generate e-waybill from one to another state
column8: Only numbers are allowed.

column2: cessValue
column8: Only numbers are allowed.

column2: cessNonAdvolValue
column8: Only numbers are allowed.

column2: Others
column8: Negative and Non negative numbers are allowed.

column2: totInvValue
column4: Sum of assessable value , tax value and other charges
column8: Sum of Assessable value, CGST Amount, SGST Amount, IGST Amount, CESS Amount, CESS Non Advol Amount and Others  should be lesser than or equal to  the Total Invoice Value.(Only 2 Rupee difference is allowed)

column2: transMode
column7: Its mandatory when generating part B
column8: Only valid Trans Mode is allowed.

column2: transDistance
column8: Only numbers are allowed. Distance should be lesser than or equal to 4000 KM.

column2: transporterName
column8: Only alpha numeric keys and  @,  # , -,  /,, &, . are allowed.

column2: transporterId
column7: To generate only Part A slip, Transporter ID is mandatory
column8: Only valid GSTIN are allowed.

column2: transDocNo
column7: Mandatory if Trans mode is Rail/Air/Ship
column8: Only alpha numeric keys and  - (hyphen),   / (slash) and .(dot) are allowed.

column2: transDocDate
column7: Mandatory if Trans mode is Rail/Air/Ship
column8: Trans Date should be in DD/MM/YYYY format.

column2: vehicleNo
column5:
KA12KA1234          OR
KA12K1234             OR   
KA123456                OR
KAR1234                  OR              KA123K1234           OR 
KA12KAR1234        OR   DFXXXXXX               OR         TRXXXXXX               OR           BPXXXXXX               OR  NPXXXXXX
column7: Mandatory if Mode of transportation is Road and Trans DocNo is not entered
column8: Only valid vehicle numbers are allowed.

column2: vehicleType
column7: Mandatory If Trans Mode is Road
column8: Only Regular or ODC (Over Dimentional Cargo) are allowed.

column2: taxableAmount
column8: Only Standard Tax Rates are allowed(Refer Table 1 in the Validation sheet).

column2: transactionType
column8: only numbers are allowed.

column2: 1)Generation of E Way Bill using the E Way Bill API System will be blocked for the following scenarios where the Supplier is enabled for E Invoice. Such E Way Bills need to be generated either along with the IRN generation or with reference to the IRN using E Invoice System only />
• B2B and Export transactions where document date is equal to or greater than 01/10/2020 • Document type - Tax Invoice
2)If the other party GSTIN is cancelled, generation of E Way Bill is allowed if the document date is within the period during which the GSTIN was active

3)If the distance is passed as ‘0’ (Zero) and the distance between the PIN codes provided is available in E Way Bill database, the system will replace the distance as per the database. Passing ‘0’ is an indication that the user wants the system to take the distance as per the E Way Bill database
4)If the distance is passed and is differing by more than ±10% of the pin to pin distance stored in system, the response will have corresponding error code

5)If the distance is passed and the actual distance in database is less that 100 kms, the distance passed has to be less than distance in database plus 10% of the distance. (Ex. If the distance is 60 kms, distance up to 66kms is allowed)

6)If the distance between the two pin-codes provided is not available in E Way Bill database, E-waybill will be generated with an alert message as "The distance between the given PIN codes are not available in the system." and it’s a responsibility of the generator to provide correct distance in such cases.
7)If fromPincode and toPincode are same then, maximum distance allowed is 100 kms. If the supply type is ‘Line Sales’, it can be up to 300 kms
8)The actual distance from source to destination cannot be greater than 4000.
9)PIN Codes are validated against the State they belong to, actFromStateCode- fromPincode and actToStateCode- toPincod
If the PIN Code does not exist in the master database of the E Way Bill System and the first 3 digits of the PIN code matches with the respective State as per the
10)pattern of PIN code-to-State mapping pattern defined by postal department, then E Way Bill gets generated
11)For ‘Other Country’, State code as 96 as well as 99 are accepted but system stores the state code as 99

12)Generation of duplicate E-waybills for the same document by Consignee and Transporter is not allowed hence forth, hence now onwards neither Consignor nor Consignee nor Transporter can generate duplicate E-waybills for the same document.

13)For SKD/CKD/Lots movement in multiple vehicles, you have to generate a delivery challan for each of the vehicle containing the items being moved in the respective vehicles, the last vehicle should carry the original invoice.
14)Regeneration of e-waybill is possible for the cancelled e-waybill as well as for the E-waybill having status "DIS".
15)For Outward, if Bill To GSTIN(toGstin) belongs to SEZ, Bill To state(toState) should be Other Country and ship to statecode (actTostatecode) should be the actual state code.

16)Similarly for Inward, if Bill From GSTIN(fromGstin) belongs to SEZ, Bill From state(fromState) should be Other Country and Dispatch from statecode (actFromstatecode) should be the actual state code.
17)Tax rates are being validated. Only the allowed tax rates will be accepted.
18)Document type is validated against the supply and sub supply type. Accordingly, the type of Consigner and Consignee is allowed.

19)The system checks for the duplicate e-way bill on the same document number of the consignor. If already one e-way bill exists with same document number, the system will not allow generating one more e-way bill on the same number. That is, if the consignor is trying to generate multiple e-way bills based on one document number, the system throws error. Even if the consignee or transporter tries to generate an E Way Bill for the same document number, system will not allow generation of E Way Bill as consigner himself has used the document number for generation of E Way Bill.

However, if consignee or transporter tries to generate the multiple e-way bills on the same document number of the consignor, provided the consigner has not used the document number already to generate E Way Bill, the system will generate E Way Bill and alert through API to the consignee or transporter that already there is one e-way bill with that document number.
20)To identify the type of movement of goods, type of transaction is being captured.
21)Additional fields for cessNonAdvolValue and otherValue have been introduced to enter CESS Non Advol amount and any other charges (+/-) written in invoice.
22)Sum of totalValue, cgstValue, sgstValue, igstValue, cessValue , otherValue and cessNonAdvolValue should be equal to or less than totInvValue with a grace value of Rs. 2.00.
23)We have added a new Status DIS for such E Way bills that have been generated with only Part A and Part B is not updated even after 15 days of generation of this temporary number.
24)Passing transporterId is mandatory for generating Part A Slip and transDocNo, transMode and vehicleNo should be blank.
25)Alerting the generator of the E-Way Bill through SMS message, in case the total invoice value is more than Rs. 10 Crores.

26)GSTR1 fields (cgstValue, sgstValue, igstValue, cessValue, totalValue, otherValue and totInvValue in main object and cgstRate, sgstRate, igstRate, cessRate, cessNonAdvol, taxableAmount) are mandatory as per the intrastate or interstate transaction.
27)Maximum number of items in each invoice should not exceed more than 250 items.
28)In case of tax payer generating as supplier, the GSTIN of the requesting tax payer should be fromGstin
29)In case of tax payer generating as recipient, the GSTIN of the requesting tax payer should be - toGstin
30)In case of transporter(enrolled transporter / GSTIN updated as transporter in e-way bill portal) generating e-way bill, the GSTIN/TRANSIN of the requesting person should be -transporterId
31)Enrolled transporter(TRANSIN) cannot be supplier (- fromGstin) or buyer (- toGstin)
32)The following fields should have the one of the values given in the master codes
1. Supply Type 2. Sub Supply Type 3. Document Type 4. Transportation Mode 5. Unit Quantity Code
33)The Document Date should be less than or equal to current date
34)The Transport document Date should be greater than equal to document date
35)- fromGstin and - toGstin should be valid GSTIN number of the supplier and recipient. In case of unregistered person involved in the transaction, pass URP in these fields.

36)In case of ‘Bill to – ship to’ transaction, - toGstin,- toTrdName and - toStateCode should be passed with ‘Bill To’ party and - toAddr1, - toAddr2, - toPlace, - toPincode and - actToStateCode values should be passed with ‘Ship To’ party.

37)In case of ‘Bill From – Dispatch From’ transaction, - fromGstin, - fromTrdName and - fromStateCode should be passed with ‘Bill From’ party and - fromAddr1, - fromAddr2, - fromPlace, - fromPincode and - actFromStateCode values should be passed with ‘Dispatch from’ party.
38)e-Way Bill cannot be generated with only SAC codes(99) for Services, minimum one HSN code belonging to Goods is mandatory.
39)HSN Code should be valid as per the GST master
40)In case of intra-state transaction, where both - fromGstin and - toGstin belong to same state(fromStateCode and toStateCode should be same), the SGST and CGST tax rate and value has to be passed
41)In case of inter-state transaction, where both - fromGstin and - toGstin belong to different states(fromStateCode and toStateCode should be different), the IGST tax rate and value has to be passed
42)In case of one of the party is SEZ unit, then IGST tax rate and value has to be passed
43)In case of road is a transportation mode , the vehicle number should be passed and transport document number is optional
44)In case of rail, air or ship is a transportation mode, the transport document number is must
45)If the transportation is done through the transporter, trans_id field should have valid TRANSID or GSTIN
46)In case of road transportation, if the vehicle is ‘over dimension cargo’, pass O, otherwise R (regular).
47)Vehicle type ODC is provisioned for transport mode 'Ship' 48)If Mode transportation is selected has ship, the vehicle type can be ODC and Vehicle Number has to be provided
49)UQC Code while Initializing multi-vehicle movement UQC value is not validating against the UQC provided while generating Eway bill
50)If vehicle number is passed, the format of the vehicle should be valid and as per the format
51)For temporary registered vehicles, the registration number format should be ‘TMXXXXXX’
52)In case of sub supply type is others, then pass the - subSupplyDesc accordingly.
53)In case of import or export, the actual distance being travelled in the country has to be passed.
